name: Pork Rice Paper Roll
description: Rice paper rolls with pork filling. Perfect for a quick lunchtime snack if the meat is already prepped or great for a social dinner.

recipeInstructions.name: Marinate Pork
recipeInstructions.text: Combine ginger, hoisin and soy sauce well. Put half the mixture in another bowl with the pork sliced into long thin pieces. Mix the pork with the mixture thoroughly. Marinate for 1 hour.

recipeInstructions.name: Prep Sauce
recipeInstructions.text: Mix the fish sauce, lime juice, sugar and chilli thoroughly in a bowl. If its too strong add a little bit of water until its to your liking.

recipeInstructions.name: Prep Noodles
recipeInstructions.text: Add vermicelli noodles to a bowl with hot water. Cover and leave for 8-10 minutes or until noodles are tender. Drain.

recipeInstructions.name: Prep Veg
recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice your vegetables. Lay plate out with warm water in it.

recipeInstructions.name: Cook Pork
recipeInstructions.text: Heat a non-stick pan, add the oil and the pork and cook for about 5 minutes or until the pork is cooked through and tender. Put aside for rolls.

recipeInstructions.name: Put together
recipeInstructions.text: Submerge rice paper in water for 3 seconds and lay flat on a cloth. Don't worry if its not immediately soft, it will soften up very quickly. Lay your desired filling out in the middle of your rice paper. Fold in sides and roll into a nice little log. Enjoy with the dipping sauce and leftover hoisin mix!

notes: You can sub out the pork for all types of protein like chicken, beef, prawns, duck, etc. For beef I would recommend a lemongrass, ginger and soy sauce mix.
If you prep ingredients earlier can be great for easy lunches or dinners.
